author: Maynwaring, Arthur, 1668-1712.
notes: Verse - "I sing the man that rais'd a shirtless band".
A satire on the earl of Warrington and his Cheshire men entering London in state; "The King of hearts" was a name applied to him.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Warrington, Henry Booth, --  Earl of, 1652-1694 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
